feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 20 at 5:39PM AKDT until October 21 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKDT Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 20 at 5:39PM AKDT until October 21 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Central Arctic Plains and Central Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until 4 PM AKDT Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range

entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm With Heavy Snow and Blowing Snow Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night... A strong storm moving into the Western Bering and Chukchi Seas on Sunday will move along the West Coast of Alaska on Monday. This will bring a mix of rain and snow and south winds 30 mph gusting to 50 mph to the West Coast of Alaska west of Golovin and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Interior Seward Peninsula; Noatak Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm With High Surf Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night... South winds of 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph over the Bering and Chukchi Seas on Sunday will spread to the West Coast of Alaska Sunday night into Monday. This will bring the possibility of high surf and minor coastal flooding to the West Coast of Alaska from
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Bering Strait Coast; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 20 at 2:09PM AKDT until October 21 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility. West winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less. * WHERE...Over Steese Highway Summits. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKDT Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through This Evening... Elevated surf will continue this evening and cause minor beach erosion. Northwest winds to 25 mph will decrease to 15 mph late tonight. The surf will decrease after midnight. Residents with items on the beach should move them inland to prevent them from washing away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Saturday... Elevated surf will continue through Saturday and cause minor beach erosion. Northwest winds gusting to 40 mph will decrease to 20 mph on Saturday. The elevated surf will continue through Saturday then decrease Saturday evening. People at Utqiagvik should be aware of increased beach erosion
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Sunday... Elevated surf will continue through Sunday and cause minor beach erosion. Northwest winds 40 to 50 mph will continue into Saturday, then gradually decrease Saturday night into Sunday. Residents with items on the beach should move them inland to prevent them from washing away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Flood Statement issued October 20 at 5:27PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 9 PM TONIGHT... WHAT...Minor flooding resulting from heavy rain WHERE...Tutuila Aunuu and Manu`a WHEN...Through 9 pm tonight IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall and runoff may cause elevated stream and drainage ditch levels. Ponding may occur on roads and low lying areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 20 at 8:47PM PDT until October 21 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet with local sets to 9 feet tonight. For Saturday, surf will be 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet along with strong rip currents. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: San Diego County Coastal Areas

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 20 at 7:48PM PDT until October 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 3 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet is expected through late this evening, then subsiding some tonight and Saturday. However, there will be a high risk of dangerous rip currents through Saturday afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 20 at 7:48PM PDT until October 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet expected on west to northwest facing beaches through late tonight. However, elevated surf will continue through Saturday, along with a high risk of strong and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara
entry.cap:areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 20 at 7:48PM PDT until October 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves 6 to 8 feet are expected through late tonight. Surf is forecast to subside slowly tonight, lowering to 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet by early Saturday. Elevated surf will continue through Saturday afternoon along with a high risk of strong rip currents.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Ventura County Beaches

entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued October 20 at 12:36PM EDT until October 21 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Bay, Gulf, and Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 21 at 12:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog Overnight Across Coastal Downeast... Areas of fog, locally dense at times, will continue across coastal Downeast Maine through the overnight hours. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 20 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE ACTION DAY... The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an Ozone Action Day for the Austin area for Saturday, October 21, 2023. Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing high levels of ozone air pollution in the Austin area on Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bastrop; Caldwell; Hays; Travis; Williamson

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 20 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 7 PM CDT SATURDAY... The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality is forecasting a Code Orange Air Quality Alert, from 7 AM to 7 PM CDT Saturday. entry.cap:areaDesc: Hardin; Lower Jefferson; Northern Orange; Southern Orange; Upper Jefferson
